page.title: 13Transport in Waltham St L.
page.content:
The villages of{Waltham St Lawrence and{Shurlock Row}are served by only one bus route which goes into{ {Maidenhead}. The service is only four times each day. There is no other access to public transport in the area.
It is possible with a car to reach major ways of travel very easily. The main{Railway}from {London}to the{West} passes through the area and there is a {station}at Twyford, 4 miles away. The {M4 Motorway}goes just to the south of the area and can be reached easily in 10 minutes. The{passenger aircraft} which fly over the area are easily reached at{Heathrow Airport}which is only about 12 miles away.
If you haven't got a car then getting around the area is difficult.
